oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Advertisement for a summer resort for African Americans in Shelbyville.

This ad, published in the Nashville Globe on April 2, 1909, is for a summer resort taking place in Shelbyville, Tennessee. During segregation, travel was as segregated as the rest of society. This ad claims that the only resort for African Americans in the state would be open on the grounds of Turner Normal School in Shelbyville. Turner Normal College was established by the AME Church in Shelbyville in 1886 as a high school and relocated to Memphis in 1935.
